triples.name: Parametricity
triples.relevance: Parametricity is the fundamental theoretical basis for free theorems that the paper extends to account for seq.

triples.name: Parametric polymorphism
triples.relevance: The paper builds on parametric polymorphism to derive free theorems about polymorphic functions.

triples.name: Functional programming
triples.relevance: The paper addresses challenges in free theorems for nonstrict functional programming languages.

triples.name: Haskell (programming language)
triples.relevance: Haskell is the primary programming language discussed, as it has seq which breaks standard parametricity.

triples.name: Lambda calculus
triples.relevance: The Girard-Reynolds calculus discussed in the paper extends lambda calculus to formalize the theoretical framework.

triples.name: System F
triples.relevance: System F is the formal calculus that provides the theoretical foundation for parametric polymorphism in the paper.

triples.name: Algebraic data type
triples.relevance: The paper studies free theorems for languages with algebraic datatypes alongside parametric polymorphism.

triples.name: Program transformation
triples.relevance: The paper derives criteria for proving that program transformations like short cut fusion remain valid with seq.

triples.name: Fixed-point combinator
triples.relevance: The Girard-Reynolds calculus includes fixpoints which enable recursive definitions in the theoretical framework.

triples.name: Type theory
triples.relevance: The paper proposes new theoretical results about relations in type theory that recover parametricity in the presence of seq.
